dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, have you seen the latest news from Lucid Motors? They, uh, just made a pretty significant hire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, have you seen the latest news from Lucid Motors? They, uh, just made a pretty significant hire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: MOTORS Lucid Motors, a startup maker of luxury electric cars that plans to start building its first model next year, hired a veteran Tesla manufacturing executive as investors and analysts wait for Tesla to report its quarterly delivery and production results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, I did catch that! Peter Hochholdinger, right? The Tesla guy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I did catch that! Peter Hochholdinger, right? The Tesla guy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Silicon Valley-based Lucid said that Peter Hochholdinger has joined the company as vice president of manufacturing. Hochholdinger was previously Teslas vice president of production...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Peter Hochholdinger, yeah. He's coming on board as their new VP of manufacturing. I mean, this is huge, considering his background.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Peter Hochholdinger, yeah. He's coming on board as their new V P of manufacturing. I mean, this is huge, considering his background.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Silicon Valley-based Lucid said that Peter Hochholdinger has joined the company as vice president of manufacturing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Right? I mean, for a startup like Lucid to poach someone with that kind of experience... it really says something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I mean, for a startup like Lucid to poach someone with that kind of experience... it really says something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. He was, like, Tesla's VP of production, remember, during that whole "manufacturing hell" period with the Model 3 ramp-up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. He was, like, Tesla's V P of production, remember, during that whole manufacturing hell period with the Model three ramp-up?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hochholdinger was previously Teslas vice president of production, a role hed held since May 2016, a turbulent period marked by what CEO Elon Musk dubbed the manufacturing hell of ramping up Model 3 output.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, man, the Model 3. That was, uh, quite a time. So he's seen the trenches, so to speak.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, man, the Model three. That was, uh, quite a time. So he's seen the trenches, so to speak.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And before that, 14 years at Toyota! So, he's got that, you know, established auto industry pedigree *and* the EV startup experience.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And before that, fourteen years at Toyota! So, he's got that, you know, established auto industry pedigree and the E V startup experience.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before joining Tesla, he spent 24 years at Audi.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's a powerful combo. So, Lucid must be, like, really serious about this next phase, getting the Air into production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a powerful combo. So, Lucid must be, like, really serious about this next phase, getting the Air into production.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, they are. Peter Rawlinson, their CEO, he's basically saying Hochholdinger is gonna be invaluable for launching the Lucid Air and future models. They're aiming for, uh, volume production next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, they are. Peter Rawlinson, their C E O, he's basically saying Hochholdinger is gonna be invaluable for launching the Lucid Air and future models. They're aiming for, uh, volume production next year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hochholdingers extensive experience and proven leadership in premium-vehicle manufacturing will prove invaluable as we continue our progress towards the launch of Lucid Air and future models, CEO and CTO Rawlinson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And the Air is supposed to be, like, super premium, even more than a Model X, right? Over a hundred grand?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And the Air is supposed to be, like, super premium, even more than a Model X, right? Over a hundred grand?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Air, which Lucid has been developing for more than three years, is to be even more premium than Teslas Model S, priced from over $100,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's what they're positioning it as. Very high-end. And they've, like, secured some serious funding too, you know, Qatar's public investment fund is a major backer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's what they're positioning it as. Very high-end. And they've, like, secured some serious funding too, you know, Qatar's public investment fund is a major backer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucid has raised more than $1 billion to get into production, with Saudi Arabias public investment fund signing on as a major backer in September 2018...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, the Qatar connection... [chuckles] Wasn't there some, uh, interesting history there with Elon Musk and his "funding secured" tweet?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, the Qatar connection... Wasn't there some, uh, interesting history there with Elon Musk and his funding secured tweet?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...with Saudi Arabias public investment fund signing on as a major backer in September 2018, just after Musk incorrectly claimed hed secured funding from the Saudis to take Tesla private.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Oh, there certainly was! A little bit of irony there, perhaps. But yeah, Lucid seems to be, uh, making steady progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, there certainly was! A little bit of irony there, perhaps. But yeah, Lucid seems to be, uh, making steady progress.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they're building that factory in Arizona, right? Phoenix area, aiming for 50,000 units a year initially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're building that factory in Arizona, right? Phoenix area, aiming for fifty thousand units a year initially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucids factory is to be built in Casa Grande, Arizona, midway between Phoenix and Tucson, and, initially, will be relatively small scale, with capacity to produce just 20,000 units a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the plan. I mean, the whole industry is shifting to EVs, and everyone from VW to Rivian is trying to compete with Tesla. This just shows Lucid is serious about being a major player.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the plan. I mean, the whole industry is shifting to E Vs, and everyone from V W to Rivian is trying to compete with Tesla. This just shows Lucid is serious about being a major player.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucids move toward volume production from next year comes amid an industrywide shift to electrified vehicles, with companies ranging from global powerhouses Volkswagen, Audi, General Motors, Nissan, Renault, Jaguar Land Rover and Volvo to startups including Rivian, Byton and Nio all planning battery-powered to compete with Tesla.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's going to be fascinating to watch them, uh, try to deliver on that quality Peter Rawlinson was talking about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's going to be fascinating to watch them, uh, try to deliver on that quality Peter Rawlinson was talking about.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, especially with Hochholdinger's background, he knows what it takes to scale. Big move for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, especially with Hochholdinger's background, he knows what it takes to scale. Big move for them.
